unnormalised: **Fiber-to-Home Expansion Gains Momentum in India's Telecom Sector**
normalised: fiber to home expansion gains momentum in India's telecom sector

unnormalised: New Delhi – India's telecommunications landscape is undergoing a significant transformation with the accelerated rollout of Fiber-to-Home (FTTH) infrastructure. Reliance Jio and Bharti Airtel are leading the charge, aggressively expanding their fiber networks to meet the growing demand for high-speed internet, particularly in Tier-II and Tier-III cities.
normalised: New Delhi – India's telecommunications landscape is undergoing a significant transformation with the accelerated rollout of Fiber to Home (F T T H) infrastructure. Reliance Jio and Bharti Airtel are leading the charge, aggressively expanding their fiber networks to meet the growing demand for high speed internet, particularly in Tier two and Tier three cities.

unnormalised: Recent reports indicate that over 200,000 km of optical fiber cable was laid in the last fiscal year alone. This surge is fueled by government initiatives like the BharatNet project, aiming to connect all gram panchayats with broadband.
normalised: Recent reports indicate that over two hundred thousand kilometer of optical fiber cable was laid in the last fiscal year alone. This surge is fueled by government initiatives like the BharatNet project, aiming to connect all gram panchayats with broadband.

unnormalised: "The pandemic highlighted the critical need for robust connectivity," stated Professor Mehra of IIT Delhi, a leading expert in telecommunications. "Just as 'Sholay' showcased the importance of friendship, FTTH demonstrates the crucial role of reliable internet access in modern India."
normalised: "The pandemic highlighted the critical need for robust connectivity," stated Professor Mehra of I I T Delhi, a leading expert in telecommunications. "Just as 'Sholay' showcased the importance of friendship, F T T H demonstrates the crucial role of reliable internet access in modern India."

unnormalised: Analysts predict that FTTH subscriptions will surpass 40 million by the end of 2024, driven by competitive pricing and bundled service offerings. Furthermore, major players are investing heavily in technology upgrades to support speeds exceeding 1 Gbps, paving the way for bandwidth-intensive applications like online gaming and 4K video streaming. Investment in this sector is expected to cross Rs. 25,000 crore in the next three years.
normalised: Analysts predict that F T T H subscriptions will surpass forty million by the end of two thousand and twenty four, driven by competitive pricing and bundled service offerings. Furthermore, major players are investing heavily in technology upgrades to support speeds exceeding one G B P S, paving the way for bandwidth intensive applications like online gaming and four K video streaming. Investment in this sector is expected to cross rupee twenty five thousand crore in the next three years.
